00032 // Test the Error object scanner, parser and class.
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 4/25/96
00035 
00036 #include "config_dap.h"
00037 
00038 static char rcsid[] not_used = {"$Id$"};
00039 
00040 #include <assert.h>
00041 
00042 #include <GetOpt.h>
00043 
00044 #include "Error.h"
00045 #include "parser.h"
00046 #include "Error.tab.h"
00047 
00048 void test_scanner();
00049 void test_parser(Error &err);
00050 #ifdef GUI
00051 void test_object(Error &err);
00052 #endif
00053 void usage();
00054 
00055 int Errorlex();
00056 int Errorparse(void *);
00057 
00058 extern YYSTYPE Errorlval;
00059 extern int Errordebug;
00060 const char *prompt = "error-test: ";
00061 
00062 #ifdef WIN32
00063 void
00064 #else
00065 int
00066 #endif
00067 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00068 {
00069 #ifdef WIN32
00070     GetOpt getopt (argc, argv, "spd");
00071 #else
00072     GetOpt getopt (argc, argv, "spdo");
00073 #endif
00074     int option_char;
00075     bool scanner_test = false, parser_test = false, object_test = false;
00076 
00077     // process options
00078 
00079     while ((option_char = getopt ()) != EOF)
00080     switch (option_char)
00081       {
00082         case 'd': 
00083           Errordebug = 1;
00084           break;
00085         case 's':
00086           scanner_test = true;
00087           break;
00088         case 'p':
00089           parser_test = true;
00090           break;
00091 #ifndef WIN32
00092         case 'o':
00093           parser_test = object_test = true;
00094           break;
00095 #endif
00096         case '?': 
00097         default:
00098           usage();
00099       }
00100 
00101 #ifdef WIN32
00102     if (!(scanner_test || parser_test))
00103 #else
00104     if (!(scanner_test || parser_test || object_test))
00105 #endif
00106     usage();
00107 
00108     if (scanner_test)
00109     test_scanner();
00110 
00111     Error err;
00112     if (parser_test)
00113     test_parser(err);
00114 
00115 #ifdef GUI
00116     if (object_test)
00117     test_object(err);
00118 #endif
00119 
00120 #ifdef WIN32
00121     exit(0);  //  Cygwin/Dejagu test suites require this to succeed.
00122     return;   //  Visual C++ requires this.
00123 #endif
00124 }
00125 
00126 void
00127 usage()
00128 {
00129 #ifdef WIN32
00130     fprintf( stderr, "usage: error-test: [d][sp] <  filename ...\n" ) ;
00131 #else
00132     fprintf( stderr, "usage: error-test: [d][spo] <  filename ...\n" ) ;
00133 #endif
00134     fprintf( stderr, "       d: extra parser debugging information\n" ) ;
00135     fprintf( stderr, "       s: run the scanner\n" ) ;
00136     fprintf( stderr, "       p: run the parser\n" ) ;
00137 #ifdef WIN32
00138     fprintf( stderr, "       o: evaluate the object, runs the parser\n" ) ;
00139 #endif
00140 }
00141 
00142 void
00143 test_scanner()
00144 {
00145     int tok;
00146 
00147     fprintf( stdout, "%s", prompt ) ; // first prompt
00148     fflush( stdout ) ;
00149     while ((tok = Errorlex())) {
00150     switch (tok) {
00151       case SCAN_ERROR:
00152         fprintf( stdout, "ERROR\n" ) ;
00153         break;
00154       case SCAN_CODE:
00155         fprintf( stdout, "CODE\n" ) ;
00156         break;
00157       case SCAN_PTYPE:
00158         fprintf( stdout, "PTYPE\n" ) ;
00159         break;
00160       case SCAN_MSG:
00161         fprintf( stdout, "MSG\n" ) ;
00162         break;
00163       case SCAN_PROGRAM:
00164         fprintf( stdout, "PROGRAM\n" ) ;
00165         break;
00166       case SCAN_STR:
00167         fprintf( stdout, "%s\n", Errorlval.string ) ;
00168         break;
00169       case SCAN_INT:
00170         fprintf( stdout, "%d\n", Errorlval.integer ) ;
00171         break;
00172       case '{':
00173         fprintf( stdout, "Left Brace\n" ) ;
00174         break;
00175       case '}':
00176         fprintf( stdout, "Right Brace\n" ) ;
00177         break;
00178       case ';':
00179         fprintf( stdout, "Semicolon\n" ) ;
00180         break;
00181       case '=':
00182         fprintf( stdout, "Assignment\n" ) ;
00183         break;
00184       default:
00185         fprintf( stdout, "Error: Unrecognized input\n" ) ;
00186     }
00187     fprintf( stdout, "%s", prompt ) ; // print prompt after output
00188     fflush( stdout ) ;
00189     }
00190 }
00191 
00192 void
00193 test_parser(Error &err)
00194 {
00195     int status = err.parse(stdin);
00196     fprintf( stdout, "Status from parser: %d\n", status ) ;
00197     
00198     if (err.OK())
00199     fprintf( stdout, "Error passed OK check\n" ) ;
00200     else 
00201     fprintf( stdout, "Error failed OK check\n" ) ;
00202 
00203     err.print(stdout);
00204 }
00205 
00206 #ifdef GUI
00207 void
00208 test_object(Error &err)
00209 {
00210     Gui g;
00211 
00212     string response = err.correct_error(&g);
00213     
00214     fprintf( stdout, "Response: %s\n", response.c_str() ) ;
00215 }
00216 #endif
